body:
This used to be caused by having the Chrome devtools set to "Pause On Caught Exceptions". In old versions of Chrome, it was easy to accidentally put the devtools into this state since it could be cycled into just by clicking repeatedly on the unlabelled hexagonal pause icon in the Sources tab, which used to cycle between three states: "Pause On All Exceptions", "Pause On Uncaught Exceptions", and "Don't Pause On Exceptions".

In newer versions of Chrome, this UI deficiency has been corrected by making pausing on caught exceptions require checking an explicitly labelled checkbox that appears after "Pause on exceptions" mode is entered, both circled in red below:
title: "Paused on exception: DOMException" when browsing websites with the console open
